page.title: 20THE CHURCH KEY
page.content: ST EDMUND'S,ACLE,LIKE MANY OLD CHURCHES,POSSESSES A HUGE MEDIAEVAL KEY WHICH UNLOCKS THE FRONT DOOR. IN THE PAST,SHOULD A LOCAL COUPLE BE UNABLE TO AFFORD A WEDDING RING,OR SHOULD THE BEST MAN FORGET TO BRING ONE TO THE CEREMONY,THEN THE BRIDE'S FINGER WAS SLIPPED THROUGH THE KEY INSTEAD.IN 1930 A YOUNG COUPLE (MUCH TO THE DISAPPROVAL OF THE GIRL'S FATHER) ANNOUNCED THEIR INTENTION OF MARRYING.THE FATHER,BEING WELL-AWARE OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE KEY,REMOVED IT FROM THE CHURCH.FOR 37 YEARS ITS WHEREABOUTS REMAINED A MYSTERY NO-ONE COULD SOLVE,UNTIL FINALLY IT WAS DISCOVERED AT BRISTON CHURCH IN NORTH NORFOLK AND RETURNED TO ACLE. (PRESUMABLY TO THE RELIEF OF THE STILL UNMARRIED COUPLE!)
